snippet: A Manhattan federal judge said the testimony of Khalid Shaikh Mohammed would not be permitted at the trial of a son-in-law of Osama bin Laden.
abstract: Federal Judge Lewis A Kaplan in Manhattan rules that Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, self-described architect of the Sept. 11 attacks, will not be permitted to provide testimony in the terrorism trial of Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, former top adviser to Osama bin Laden; says defense request is baseless on merits and because of defense's delay in seeking the testimony.
lead_paragraph: A Manhattan federal judge said the testimony of Khalid Shaikh Mohammed would not be permitted at the trial of a son-in-law of Osama bin Laden.

headline.main: Trial Judge Will Not Allow 9/11 Architect’s Testimony
headline.print_headline: Trial Judge Will Not Allow 9/11 Architect’s Testimony
